stanza.line: O that you were your self but love you areare
No longer yours than you your self here livelive
Against this coming end you should prepareprepare
And your sweet semblance to some other givegive
So should that beauty which you hold in leaselease
Find no determination then you werewere
Your self again after your self deceasedecease
When your sweet issue your sweet form should bearbear
Who lets so fair a house fall to decaydecay
Which husbandry in honour might upholduphold
Against the stormy gusts of winter dayday
And barren rage of death eternal coldcold
O none but unthrifts dear my love you knowknow
You had a father let your son say soso
